revision.text:
{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = AzureWave_AW-NB037H |wikipedia = |brand = AzureWave |model = AW-NB037H |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = July 28, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/AzureWave_AW-NB037H |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 002b |subvendor_id = 1a3b |subdevice_id = 2c37 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = PPD-AR5B195 |icid = 4104A-AR5B195 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:08:CA, 1C:4B:D6, 74:2F:68, E0:B9:A5 |chip1 = Atheros;AR9285; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = Bluetooth |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/09/2009 |estreldate = |price = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B008J4C8PE |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This device uses the [[Atheros AR5B195]] / WB195 reference design. This device is the wireless module for the.. *ASUS EEE PC X101 (Meego edition) - FCC ID: MSQ-X101NB037H *ASUS 1025CE - FCC ID: MSQ-1025CNB037H *[http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-t-904784-start-0.html ASUS N53SV] *[http://h-node.org/notebooks/view/en/804/K53SD ASUS K53SD] *[https://pastebin.com/MiH2TznP ASUS U36SD] *[http://vip.asus.com/forum/view.aspx?id=20110517103025753&board_id=1&model=Rampage+III+Black+Edition&page=1&SLanguage=en-us ASUS Rampage III Black Edition] ([http://www.guru3d.com/articles_pages/asus_rampage_iii_black_edition_review,1.html review with images]) *and probably others The device is on [http://download.bto.eu/Notebooks/15P35%20-%20(A25PA)/A25A_A25HC_A25HD_A25PA_V2.04.xls this] list. The USB ID for the BT chip is 13d3:3304. [http://download.bto.eu/Notebooks/15P35%20-%20(A25PA)/A25A_A25HC_A25HD_A25PA_V2.04.xls] [http://vip.asus.com/forum/view.aspx?id=20110517103025753&board_id=1&model=Rampage+III+Black+Edition&page=1&SLanguage=en-us] Output of '''sudo lspci -vvnnq -d 168c:002b''' [http://pastebin.com/6vJ1v9hw here], or [https://cloud.openmailbox.org/public.php?service=files&t=a9ce4c98020cebea7859f28106741302&download here], or [https://pastebin.com/MiH2TznP here].
Output of '''sudo lsusb -v -d 13d3:3304''' [http://pastebin.com/D7x6X2sP here], or [https://cloud.openmailbox.org/public.php?service=files&t=971ba461310ace41e0ca1ae409920aac&download here]. This device supports a maximum of [[Maximum supported AP VIFs w/ Linux driver::8]] simultaneous AP VIFs w/ '''ath9k'''. {{SCollapse | '''iw list''' dump (on Ubuntu 13.04) | 
Wiphy phy0
	Band 1:
		Capabilities: 0x11ce
			HT20/HT40
			SM Power Save disabled
			RX HT40 SGI
			TX STBC
			RX STBC 1-stream
			Max AMSDU length: 3839 bytes
			DSSS/CCK HT40
		Maximum RX AMPDU length 65535 bytes (exponent: 0x003)
		Minimum RX AMPDU time spacing: 8 usec (0x06)
		HT TX/RX MCS rate indexes supported: 0-7
		Frequencies:
			* 2412 MHz [1] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2417 MHz [2] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2422 MHz [3] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2427 MHz [4] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2432 MHz [5] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2437 MHz [6] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2442 MHz [7] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2447 MHz [8] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2452 MHz [9] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2457 MHz [10] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2462 MHz [11] (16.0 dBm)
			* 2467 MHz [12] (16.0 dBm) (passive scanning)
			* 2472 MHz [13] (16.0 dBm) (passive scanning)
			* 2484 MHz [14] (17.0 dBm) (passive scanning)
		Bitrates (non-HT):
			* 1.0 Mbps
			* 2.0 Mbps (short preamble supported)
			* 5.5 Mbps (short preamble supported)
			* 11.0 Mbps (short preamble supported)
			* 6.0 Mbps
			* 9.0 Mbps
			* 12.0 Mbps
			* 18.0 Mbps
			* 24.0 Mbps
			* 36.0 Mbps
			* 48.0 Mbps
			* 54.0 Mbps
	max # scan SSIDs: 4
	max scan IEs length: 2257 bytes
	Coverage class: 0 (up to 0m)
	Supported Ciphers:
		* WEP40 (00-0f-ac:1)
		* WEP104 (00-0f-ac:5)
		* TKIP (00-0f-ac:2)
		* CCMP (00-0f-ac:4)
		* CMAC (00-0f-ac:6)
	Available Antennas: TX 0x1 RX 0x1
	Configured Antennas: TX 0x1 RX 0x1
	Supported interface modes:
		 * IBSS
		 * managed
		 * AP
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * WDS
		 * monitor
		 * mesh point
		 * P2P-client
		 * P2P-GO
	software interface modes (can always be added):
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * monitor
	valid interface combinations:
		 * #{ managed, WDS, P2P-client } <= 2048, #{ AP, mesh point, P2P-GO } <= 8,
		   total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
	Supported commands:
		 * new_interface
		 * set_interface
		 * new_key
		 * new_beacon
		 * new_station
		 * new_mpath
		 * set_mesh_params
		 * set_bss
		 * authenticate
		 * associate
		 * deauthenticate
		 * disassociate
		 * join_ibss
		 * join_mesh
		 * remain_on_channel
		 * set_tx_bitrate_mask
		 * action
		 * frame_wait_cancel
		 * set_wiphy_netns
		 * set_channel
		 * set_wds_peer
		 * Unknown command (82)
		 * Unknown command (81)
		 * Unknown command (84)
		 * Unknown command (87)
		 * Unknown command (85)
		 * Unknown command (89)
		 * Unknown command (92)
		 * testmode
		 * connect
		 * disconnect
	Supported TX frame types:
		 * IBSS: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * managed: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * mesh point: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * P2P-client: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * Unknown mode (10): 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
	Supported RX frame types:
		 * IBSS: 0x40 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * managed: 0x40 0xd0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * mesh point: 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * P2P-client: 0x40 0xd0
		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * Unknown mode (10): 0x40 0xd0
	Device supports RSN-IBSS.
	WoWLAN support:
		 * wake up on disconnect
		 * wake up on magic packet
		 * wake up on pattern match, up to 6 patterns of 1-256 bytes
	HT Capability overrides:
		 * MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
		 * maximum A-MSDU length
		 * supported channel width
		 * short GI for 40 MHz
		 * max A-MPDU length exponent
		 * min MPDU start spacing
	Device supports TX status socket option.
	Device supports HT-IBSS.
}} {{SCollapse | and an '''iw list''' dump from Ubuntu 17.10 | 
Wiphy phy0
	max # scan SSIDs: 4

		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0

	software interface modes (can always be added):
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * monitor
	valid interface combinations:
		 * #{ managed } <= 2048, #{ AP, mesh point } <= 8, #{ P2P-client, P2P-GO } <= 1,
		   total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
	HT Capability overrides:
		 * MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
		 * maximum A-MSDU length
		 * supported channel width
		 * short GI for 40 MHz
		 * max A-MPDU length exponent
		 * min MPDU start spacing
	Device supports TX status socket option.
	Device supports HT-IBSS.
	Device supports SAE with AUTHENTICATE command
	Device supports low priority scan.
	Device supports scan flush.
	Device supports AP scan.
	Device supports per-vif TX power setting
	P2P GO supports CT window setting
	Driver supports full state transitions for AP/GO clients
	Driver supports a userspace MPM
	Device supports active monitor (which will ACK incoming frames)
	Driver/device bandwidth changes during BSS lifetime (AP/GO mode)
	Device supports configuring vdev MAC-addr on create.
